Hi Bob,


Actually, I've already done the "by hand" part, where by i used a=
 
template of sorts to fill in information i needed, and used 
Equivalence =
partitioning and boundary analysis to pick suitable 
values.

I was actuall=
y considering writing from scratch the production codes 
to read in the tem=
plate and generate teh code, however my final goal 
was to integrate it wit=
h JUnit and I thought it would be easier if I 
could just build ontop of JU=
nit's existing source code for 
generating the test class template it curre=
ntly has.

The problem now is, I cant seem to find the code of JUnit that 
=
generates the test class template... this is the part where i badly 
need h=
elp. I've dled the JUnit 3.8.1 source code and look through 
them, but eith=
er I am missing it or its not there.

It might be in the Junit runtime clas=
s files, however the source 
codes for those are unavailable on sourceforge=
?

Need Help,
Jimm
